alert.note: Alert for City of Roanoke; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 7:16PM EDT until July 20 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN ROANOKE COUNTY AND THE CITY OF ROANOKE... At 716 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Roanoke... Vinton... Hollins... Cave Spring... This includes the following locations... Roanoke Regional Airport. This includes the following streams and drainages... Jumping Run Creek, Tinker Creek, Murray Run, Buffalo Creek, Carvin Creek, Coyner Branch, Mason Creek, Cook Creek and Gum Spring Branch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
